segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink, creating a sheet of water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's amazing how the woman doesn't notice the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit frustrated watching her dry that plate, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and she's just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children will slip on the wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so serene, it's hard to believe the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how calm everything seems, despite the water overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dishes on the counter are so neatly stacked, waiting to be put away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet soon before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's apron is so neat, contrasting with the growing puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children will notice the water before their mom does.
segments.speaker: PAR
